description: Triangle read by rows, representing a family of sequences M(n), for n = 0, 1, 2, ... The n-th row of the triangle consists of n+1 integers, denoted by #m(n,0), #m(n,1), ..., #m(n,n), which are the terms of the sequence M(n). They are the serial numbers of n+1 binary vectors of size 2^n, denoted by m(n,0), m(n,1), ..., m(n,n), correspondingly. Each vector m(n,k) is a characteristic vector of all vectors from the n-dimensional Boolean cube (hypercube) {0,1}^n, having (Hamming) weight equal to k, for k = 0, 1, ..., n, and for n > 0. The zeroth row (i.e., M(0)) and its single term 1 are prepended for convenience.
